name: Earthworks and Retaining Wall
template name: Ponsonby - ITP - Earthworks and Retaining Wall

name: Inspection / Test Method (Submission, Visual Inspection, Testing, Measurement, Review) - Document Review
Conformance Criteria - Control Checklist - Digging / Excavating (incl. marking out & potholing existing services).
• Notify Worksafe NZ if required. Ensure all necessary Permit to Works & Controlled Checklists are in place
Records - Permit attached or permit number noted
Detail - Ensure TMP is approved and check that the requirements are correctly interpreted and understood by the STMS
Inspection / Test Method (Submission, Visual Inspection, Testing, Measurement, Review) - Document Review
Conformance Criteria - TMP is approved by AT for the site and works are only completed within the approved dates
Detail - Ensure that Sub-Contract and Supplier Agreements are signed,  all Sub-Contractors and Suppliers are inducted to site
Inspection / Test Method (Submission, Visual Inspection, Testing, Measurement, Review) - Document Review
Conformance Criteria - Signed Subcontract and Supplier Agreements on M-Files and Induction Register updated
Records - Subcontract and Supplier Agreements, A & Updated Induction Register
Detail - Ensure that Design is approved and Drawings are of the latest revision
Inspection / Test Method (Submission, Visual Inspection, Testing, Measurement, Review) - Document Review
Conformance Criteria - IFC Label on drawings
Inspection / Test Method (Submission, Visual Inspection, Testing, Measurement, Review) - As per TNZ F/1:1997
Conformance Criteria - Maximum percenetage of weight passing 35% 0.0075m sieve shall not exceed 35% and has a sand equivalent greater than 20.
Detail - Setout cut/fill areas as required by to construct to design. Topographical surveys to be completed prior to starting, monthly and upon completion
Frequency - Prior to commencement, monthly and at completion
Inspection / Test Method (Submission, Visual Inspection, Testing, Measurement, Review) - Survey
7 - Installation of Erosion and Sediment Controls where required
Detail - Setout Environmental Controls and confirm location with Environmental Manager
Inspection / Test Method (Submission, Visual Inspection, Testing, Measurement, Review) - Review
Conformance Criteria - Correct volume for area and setup to TP90: 1999
7 - Installation of Erosion and Sediment Controls where required (2)
Detail - Design Engineer Rep/ Client Rep to inspect controls after implementation
Inspection / Test Method (Submission, Visual Inspection, Testing, Measurement, Review) - Submission
Conformance Criteria - Correct volume for area and setup to TP90: 1999
7 - Installation of Erosion and Sediment Controls where required (3)
Detail - Monitor sediments tracked out onto any roads and the generation of any Foreign objects and debris as well as dust generated
Inspection / Test Method (Submission, Visual Inspection, Testing, Measurement, Review) - Visual Inspection
Conformance Criteria - Roads free of debris using watercart where required to minimise dust generation
7 - Installation of Erosion and Sediment Controls where required (4)
Detail - Monitor effectiveness of the ESCP Controls throughout the work
Inspection / Test Method (Submission, Visual Inspection, Testing, Measurement, Review) - Measure
Conformance Criteria - In accordance with Auckland Council TP90:1999
Detail - Removal of pavement layers, vegetation, services and other objects
Inspection / Test Method (Submission, Visual Inspection, Testing, Measurement, Review) - Visual Inspection
Detail - Determine if topsoil suitable for respread after earthworks are complete
Inspection / Test Method (Submission, Visual Inspection, Testing, Measurement, Review) - Visual Inspection
Conformance Criteria - Stripping in accordance with TNZ F/1:1997
Detail - Joint inspection with Engineers Rep and carry out topo survey
Inspection / Test Method (Submission, Visual Inspection, Testing, Measurement, Review) - Visual Inspection
Conformance Criteria - Ensure topsoil stripping is complete and area is clear of organic material
Detail - Ensure stockpiles are separately stockpiled, exposed surfaces to be compacted sufficiently and away from runway, inlets and coastline
Inspection / Test Method (Submission, Visual Inspection, Testing, Measurement, Review) - Visual Inspection
Conformance Criteria - Stockpiling in accordance with TNZ F/1:1997. Stockpiles to be minimum 50m away from watercourses.
Inspection / Test Method (Submission, Visual Inspection, Testing, Measurement, Review) - Testing
Conformance Criteria - Shear vane to exceed 80 Kpa or otherwise subgrade to be undercut and repalced by specfieid granular material at Deign Engineer's discretion
Inspection / Test Method (Submission, Visual Inspection, Testing, Measurement, Review) - Survey
Conformance Criteria - As per TNZ F/1 clause 11.2.2 - All points within 30mm of true from a 3m straight edge laid parallel to centreline of road.
• The subgrade surface shall not pond water, where the design slope of the subgrade is 2% or steeper.
Frequency - 20m intervals to a depth of 1m at alternating wheel tracks
Inspection / Test Method (Submission, Visual Inspection, Testing, Measurement, Review) - Lab Testing

Conformance Criteria - Scala Penetrometer to a minimum depth of 1m and shall have no reading less than specified CBR of 3.5%, where Subgrade is gravel, Clegg hammer shall have no reading less than CIV 7.
Detail - Compaction shall be to TNZ F/1 with maximum layer thickness to not exceed 200mm
Frequency - Every 200mm lift at/ 1 test per 4m2
Inspection / Test Method (Submission, Visual Inspection, Testing, Measurement, Review) - Lab Testing
Inspection / Test Method (Submission, Visual Inspection, Testing, Measurement, Review) - Visual Inspection
Conformance Criteria - Final sign off of subgrade by Engineer.
Inspection / Test Method (Submission, Visual Inspection, Testing, Measurement, Review) - Document review

Conformance Criteria - High Density H6 treated Radiata poles to be used for construction unless specified other wise by Design Engineer H5 treated timber to be used as railings unless specified otherwise by Design Engineer
Records - Delivery Dockets/ Design Engineer Correspondence
Inspection / Test Method (Submission, Visual Inspection, Testing, Measurement, Review) - Visual Inspection
Conformance Criteria - Concrete mix to be a minimum 17.5 Mpa, high slump mix, 10mm chip.
• Minimum of 100mm cover below timber poles
Inspection / Test Method (Submission, Visual Inspection, Testing, Measurement, Review) - Visual Inspection
Conformance Criteria - Subsoils to be 110mm preforated pipe with filter sleeve sock.
• Bidim A29 or approved geofabric to be placed between drainage material and surrounding ground.
• Drainage 40/20 freeflowing aggregate to be used as bedding and cover.
Detail - Red pen mark up drawings to be included in QA file
Frequency - At the completion of the Lot of work
Inspection / Test Method (Submission, Visual Inspection, Testing, Measurement, Review) - Drawings
